Ooops, not so elegant.  Referring to my post
just a little earlier, --- there is no ref to
the Parent URI ("curi") in the schedule method.
So will be hard to copy info from parent to 
child URI.  This needs more thought.
D.

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "bergmark_d" <bergmark@C...>
wrote:
> 
> Yes, I believe making Postselector:schedule protected will do the
> trick. The main problem will be that CandidateURI's have no AList (I
> wish they did!)  But thanks much -- this is an elegant solution.
> I'll let you know if I have any problems with this.  D.
> 
> --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "stackarchiveorg"
<stack@a...>
> wrote:
> > 
> > --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "bergmark_d"
<bergmark@C...>
> > wrote:
> > > 
> > > Hi, all -- One nice feature of Mercator was the ability for the
> > > CrawlURI (docBundle in Mercator) to carry history along with
it. 
> > > Thus you could not only make the crawl uri pass information
> > > from one processor to the next, but a parent URI could pass
> > > information to child URIs.
> > > 
> > > For adaptive focused crawling, it is very helpful to be able to
> > > pass miscellaneous information from parent pages to children.
> > 
> > Yes.  Makes sense.
> > 
> > 
> > > 
> > > In Heritrix, I can see where attributes could be copied into
> > > child URIs -- in the handleLinkCollection method of the
> > > Postselector class, for example, when the CandidateURI is
> > > formed.  So I would like to extend Postselector and over-ride
> > > just this one method, but it is private.
> > > 
> > > How do you all decide which methods to make protected and which
> > > private?  Maybe it would be nice to allow the application
> > > programmer to add attributes to the CandidateURI before it goes 
> > > onto the frontier, perhaps by some call-back or by factoring
> > > out a protected and over-ridable method that decorates the
CandidateURI.
> > 
> > I made the Postselector#schedule method protected so you can
> > override it in HEAD.  Is this sufficent?
